title: AU Deals: Three Freebies, a Spidey 2 Bonus Skin, Serious Chops off Metroid, COD, and More!
description: Websling in for a sweet new fashion statement, a bunch of PC freebies, and just the best bargains on games in town today!
author: Adam Mathew
byline: The Best Gaming Deals In Australia
excerpt: Websling in for a sweet new fashion statement, a bunch of PC freebies, and just the best bargains on games in town today!
text: Because 100% off can't be beat.If you also got addicted to claiming new skins in Insomniac's Spidey series as I did, today's your day. There is some new Spidey 2 spandex available for Pete and Miles, plus the freebie train continues with a couple of PC handouts worth redeeming. Beyond that, this is a very CoD-centric dayâ€”past and discounted present. So maybe go quickscope yourself a saving. In retro news, I'm lighting a 16-shaped cake for Call of Duty: World at War. In the First Person Shooter wing of my gaming museum, WaW stands out as a pivotal, er... CoD piece. Back in the day, I travelled to Treyarch to preview this and was highly impressed with its co-op campaign (2P split or 4 online), the inaugural version of Nazi Zombies, and the way military advisor Hank Keirsey's eyes lit up when we spoke about flamethrower usage and the brave acts of Aussies in the Pacific theatre. Technically the beginning of the Black Ops sub-story that has now reached Black Ops 6, WaW stands up quite well, mostly due to an all-in performance by Gary Oldman as Viktor Reznov.Happy Bday COD: World at War This Day in Gaming ðŸŽ‚- CoD: World at War (PC,PS3,X360) 2008. html:
Because 100% off can't be beat.

If you also got addicted to claiming new skins in Insomniac's Spidey series as I did, today's your day. There is some new Spidey 2 spandex available for Pete and Miles, plus the freebie train continues with a couple of PC handouts worth redeeming. Beyond that, this is a very CoD-centric dayâ€”past and discounted present. So maybe go quickscope yourself a saving.

In retro news, I'm lighting a 16-shaped cake for Call of Duty: World at War. In the First Person Shooter wing of my gaming museum, WaW stands out as a pivotal, er... CoD piece. Back in the day, I travelled to Treyarch to preview this and was highly impressed with its co-op campaign (2P split or 4 online), the inaugural version of Nazi Zombies, and the way military advisor Hank Keirsey's eyes lit up when we spoke about flamethrower usage and the brave acts of Aussies in the Pacific theatre.

Technically the beginning of the Black Ops sub-story that has now reached Black Ops 6, WaW stands up quite well, mostly due to an all-in performance by Gary Oldman as Viktor Reznov.

Happy Bday COD: World at War

- CoD: World at War (PC,PS3,X360) 2008. Get

Nice Savings for Nintendo Switch

Ring Fit Adventure

Ring Fit Adventure is a marathon, not a sprint, just like adapting a healthy lifestyle should be. That said, after 18 hours or so I wanted to keep engaging with the fun and challenging blend of exercise and RPG mechanics it provided. 7.8/10, good.

PS5 Pro Enhanced Bargain

Need a cheap Pro showcase title?

Horizon Forbidden West - $109.95 / $79

Admittedly, I spent just as much time testing the Pro Enhancements of Horizon Zero Dawn Remastered as I did this. The targeted improvements are more or less identical across the two titles, though Forbidden West gets some extra sugar sprinkled on its unique gameplay sections, i.e., improved cloud rendering in the DLC area with a higher quality render mode. Beyond that, you can expect new upscaling and anti-aliasing algorithm for 60 fps gameplay at resolution mode quality. Improved volumetric sampling for sacreliciously good-looking godrays/volumetric lights and more overall stability. All in all, super impressive stuff.
